intro: Mussaenda hispida, commonly known as the rough mussaenda, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, stiff hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that are typically arranged in terminal inflorescences. Mussaenda hispida is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms. It thrives in warm, humid climates and prefers well-drained soil.
